website_summaries.verdict: A reliable wind-resistance exercise bike that assembles sturdy and stays that way.
pros: Fairly easy to set up, despite its weight
Wind guard and book stand are available separately
Easy to assemble, and not too large for the family room
cons: Seat is difficult to adjust and tighten, and tends to slant forward
LCD console has limited functions and can be hard to read
Belt can snap after a few months of use, and it’s prone to developing rattles and squeaks
Shorter users will have trouble reaching the handle bars

website_summaries.verdict: A reliable air bike from a reputable brand, this model will  last you for years to come.
pros: Bike runs quietly when in use
Fan produces cool air for riders
Comes with a simple monitor for easy use
Includes foot pegs for resting legs when you want to focus on your upper body workouts
cons: Belts and seats have a tendency to become loose

customer_reviews.title: Head the warnings!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this bike! I read all the bad reviews and thought it wouldn't happen to me, so I took the chance. Boy, it's exactly what the other negative reviews said. The belt is rubbing up against the wheel and starting to fray, the bearing that connects the arm bar is popping in and out causing the bike to be loud and unable to function properly. I'm literally only days past the 90 day warranty. If I could return it I would, but I can't. I haven't tried to call Schwinn yet, but I'm not hopeful. Please save yourself the trouble and get a different bike.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Weyandt

customer_reviews.title: Solid bike... great workout
customer_reviews.text: This bike is solid! Easy to assemble. Way to go Schwinn. Great workout... I've been using it almost a month now and it kicks your @$$. Like anything else, you get out of it what you put in. I would recommend this to anyone looking to get in satisfying workouts at home.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkles

customer_reviews.title: Not a new and improved design
customer_reviews.text: Not at all like the old big fan style Airdyne. I don't ride this because the seat sits too far back and there's no way to adjust it forward like with the Airdyne Pro model. If there's a replacement seat out there that adjusts forward I would buy it. As the way it is now it's just too uncomfortable to ride for any length of time. Not a well thought out design over the old Airdyne. Why should I have to pay several hundred dollars more for the Pro model just to have an adjustable seat?
customer_reviews.author: Biscuit and Gravy

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Within one week the pedal crank was chewing ...
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Within one week the pedal crank was chewing away the housing. Not the Aerodyne of the past. Returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Hilborn

customer_reviews.title: Great product for big and tall people!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Easy to assemble and NO issues! I'm 6'5" and 320lbs. I was conserned. It is stable ,sturdy and does not seem to stress under my weight. We were looking for something sturdy. For what we paid, it should be heavy duty. It is. Only thing is during the winter the wind in the face is a little much in a cool room. I did make a deflector, you can buy them. No free spin so you have to pedal always. Keeps you going. Plenty of resistance for me and my wife at 52yrs young.
customer_reviews.author: Good to go!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, heavy to move (which is a good thing!), support excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this a few days, so far so good. This thing is a beast, super well constructed (and heavy - so make sure you have someone to help initially construct it) once the feet are on it is easy to maneuver over a single floor (due to its little wheels on one foot bar) - lifting it up stairs will be an interesting proposition :-) Only one issue, i about the AD Pro / AD7 aire diverter and it would not fit because the screw clips on the wheel cage were in wrong place. Support were 5/5 in helping me get them moved and working the issue through. And yes it gives a good workout!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Balcanquall

customer_reviews.title: Great machine. Monumentally dreadful seat.
customer_reviews.text: After riding bicycles for many years, I give the Airdyne the lowest rating possible because the seat so uncomfortable that the Airdyne cannot be used. I urge all other owners do the same. Like an ordinary bicycle, Airdyne needs to use a common bicycle seat post suitable any of the wide variety of saddles conventionally mounted on bicycles. To use the Airdyne I was compelled to purchase an Exercise Bike / Bicycle Seat Adapter from Amazon for $40+. Airdyne is killing its market with its lack of adaptability and dreadful seat.
customer_reviews.author: NormalEyes

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Easy Assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an original Airdyne that was over 15 years old (but the frame broke). While the airflow is not as great as the original, this bike correlates well with an arm/leg/flywheel machine at my healthclub. Basically, I believe I am getting a better work-out. I am 6' 02", 210 pounds, an engineer, but disabled (MS). I can't stand and must use my non-dominate hand. The instructions required two people, but I easily assembled the unit by myself. All the tools were included. Assembly was simple: Eight bolts, two pedals, seat & post, and snapping the 'computer' together.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: You won't need a fan!
customer_reviews.text: Box was slightly dinged in shipment-it's a heavy beast and not easily moved-but contents were intact and undamaged. Assembly of bike can be done by one person but it's easier with two. This is a heavy duty professional grade machine you'd expect to find in a gym. In use it generates a lot of breeze with the air resistant fan and keeps you cool. This guy is a workhorse and we expect it to last through many years of heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Milestogo

customer_reviews.title: Belt Frays and Can't be Replaced!!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the bike at first, but after just a month or two, it started making a loud thwapping sound. The belt was slowly coming out of alignment and fraying. As the frayed pieces separated, they'd thwap against the inside belt. Was able to realign the belt a few times, but problem kept recurring and belt continued to wear down. Stopped using the bike regularly after just a couple months because of the racket. Only used sporadically since. So frustrating that I bought it 2 years ago, but probably only got 2 months of use out of it. Thanks, Schwinn, for making something that can't be fixed!
customer_reviews.author: G. Freyer

customer_reviews.title: Smooth with close tolerances, no play
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Operates smoothly. Solid, heavy construction. The two axis seat adjustment is a nice feature. Customer service was outstanding. Cons: Expensive, and for the price, I believe it should be able to accommodate a reading stand. A clock would be an easy, inexpensive addition. Keep the allen wrench handy as the 2 allen bolts attaching the handle bars will need to be re-torqued to keep them from slight but annoying "slop." Instructions do not tell you this.
customer_reviews.author: Dr T

customer_reviews.title: Did I overpay?
customer_reviews.text: Got my bike, seemed sturdy. Parts were a pain to put together. And now I'm a few weeks into owning it and it already sounds like I'm having gear or corrosion issues on the bike. Makes a pinging noise, and then will go away and I have a good ride. I've taken a couple panels off and keep trying to grease anything I can to make this better (thought it would be greased well off the factory line). Was disappointed on that first panel or two that I took off and 2 of the screws were rusted... Checking with customer service on what I should do.
customer_reviews.author: Trouty32

customer_reviews.title: Good bike, bad seat
customer_reviews.text: I am a senior and had to stop going to the gym due to COVID-19. Thus I got this bike to workout at home. Really nice bike which gives a great workout. However, I would have given it 5 stars except for the seat. The seat is small, hard and very uncomfortable, as other reviewers have stated. Can only ride for about 10 minutes before I have to stop. I am awaiting a more cushioned seat I ordered, along with the adapter hardware, at a combined cost of $75. I don't understand Schwinn on this seat when their competitor's fan bikes in the same price range have much better seats.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Gottesfeld

customer_reviews.title: Excellent form of cardiovascular rehab
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of those age late 60's healthy guys who worked out, watched his diet and weight, etc., and who a few months ago unexpectedly had chest pain, hospitalization, significant coronary artery occlusions, and required two stents in my coronary arteries. I began using this exact Airdyne Pro during my 36 hospital based cardiac rehabilitation sessions. I liked it so much that I decided to buy this one. Assembly was pretty simple--just take your time and read the directions. When I first got on it to start an exercise session, it was like getting reacquainted with an old friend. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Danriverboy

customer_reviews.title: Great, but....
customer_reviews.text: Solid, functional, as advertised. Easy to get a good workout, including upper body. MUST purchase a heart rate monitor from a separate mfg. but, setup is easy. Seat position could be more flexible: Horizontal distance too limited. I'm only 5'9" and have it all the way back. Vertical increments are too big. I'd be more comfortable between notches. HERE IS THE BIG NEGATIVE: With all those settings options, there is no way to store / retrieve results. Really?
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Display is limited and frustrating
customer_reviews.text: + Sturdy bike but... - Software is frustrating. Can't keep miles ridden or MPH visible (switches back to RPMs and Calories). You have to press multiple buttons to see this info and it won't let you customize the display to what you want to see regularly - Display is very low contrast and hard to see - The service number published in the instruction book is for a different (parent company). When you call you get another number to call. When you finally get through, they say they are just learning how to support this bike because the company was recently purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D'

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn Bike
customer_reviews.text: Overall, great exercise. It is on wheels so it is able to be moved which is nice. It is quite loud when riding it so just something to be aware of. Only downfall was that the box was missing a major piece: the piece connecting the seat to the bike. We tried to reach out to customer service to get it sent but got no response. Had to order it separately from another company. Was a pain for such an expensive bike but works now.
customer_reviews.author: Fitz

customer_reviews.title: I like this exercise bike
customer_reviews.text: I like this exercise bike. I had the AD6 before. I am having a problem calibrating this AD7. I even double checked the cables to make sure good connections and no pinching. I had no problems calibrating my AD6 that I had. An additional note, for as much as this costs, they should include the air diverter.
customer_reviews.author: Gene M.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!  This bike has been the catalyst for change in my life!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike! In the nearly four months that we've owned it, I've lost over 20lbs and my husband 25lbs while using this as our main source of cardio. My knee has had a lot of issues that even our rowing machine aggravated and this has rehabbed it. The bike is sturdy, doesn't rock side to side, and is tough. We added a gel seat since the seat is uncomfortable. Our butts have gotten used to it though. It has a nice little ledge to sit a tablet or phone on to keep those longer rides a little less boring.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty!  great assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: Great as in amazing assembly instructions, very heavy duty construction. Smooth operation right out of box. Very heavy duty!... You'll need two people to move the thing. First thing you see in box is Customer service number in big lights right in assembly instructions stating if you have any problems call them... Didn't need it but nice to know it was available... Say if arms didn't fit like some reviewers pointed out.
customer_reviews.author: Freq Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Three years in, still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought my AD2 from Amazon in March 2016, very nearly three years ago. The bike has gotten a lot of use in that time and so far, so good! I use it primarily for Tabata-style HIIT training, so its used for about 10 minutes each time, with alternating 20 sec full intensity / 10 sec rest periods repeated 8 times following a 3-min warmup and ending with a 2-min cool down. I also use it for 5 min warmups before playing sports such as softball and tennis and also strength training (Squat/Deadlifts/Rows/Press) and it's amazing what a difference that makes. Much more effective than simple stretching
customer_reviews.author: Scott Miles

customer_reviews.title: Can I give it 10 stars?
customer_reviews.text: Your last indoor bike—built to last. Easy cardio, HIIT, endurance—this excels in all. Rated 4 stars for ease to assemble because I needed a second person to assist with the control panel. The seat is meant for an upright posture because that is the best posture for the moving arms/upper body workout. I don’t care how good you are. If you think you’re better than any indoor bike, this machine will leave you gasping on the ground. Great news: it can be gentle for knee replacement recovery and arthritis.
customer_reviews.author: VetintheWest

customer_reviews.title: Great cardio machine
customer_reviews.text: I don’t write reviews so enjoy this. Assembly was quick under an hour by myself. All parts fit perfectly. Bike actually arrived with air diverter and console worked perfectly. Workout is insane after twenty mins of intervals your exhausted. Durable build n construction with with no maintenance required. Bike should last many years hopefully🙂
customer_reviews.author: Enmanuel

customer_reviews.title: Great So Far!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a bike that could provide a strong fast workout for a 300 pound 6' 4" male. This bike has provided plenty of resistance and durability to perform flawlessly for 7 months so far. It is amazing how smoothly and quietly it operates while providing such a powerful workout! On top of that the settings make it easy for the user to focus on and monitor the speed, calorie burn rate, or pulse rate helping you optimize your workout! We look forward to many more years of use on this wonderful dream machine!
customer_reviews.author: LEKOL

customer_reviews.title: Best exercise bike I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best exercise bike I've ever owned. It is easy to put together. Eight bolts, three machine screws and a threaded bolt for the seat adjuster. The fan is what makes this the secret to your success. The faster you pedal the resistance increases. After three days, I am already feeling a difference in my legs and arms. It's not too heavy. I am 72 and I lifted it up and moved it to the garage after putting it together. It's my everyday 'go to' workout now.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Bassman

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome after a month. easy assembly, (1 girl) just check direction of screws on arms.. one scews inside to outside other screws outside to inside. if you pay attention you can see inset for screw head but i did not. customer service knew right away when i could not torque it fully. Great adjustment... plenty of resistance that i will not outgrow ! Worth it.. rehabbing a hip & getting back in shape,super smooth motion.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Great Home Cardio
customer_reviews.text: My parents have had one of these for decades, always used it when I visited, but now I need a covid home gym. This one works exactly the same as the old one, but noticeably quieter so that's a plus. Very ergonomic and stable, not rickety like many home cardio units and can handle a lot of ergs (I'm a big guy, military and life-long athlete). Only gripe, very minor, is that I preferred the mechanical tachometer on the old school model, the new digital one does not provide quite as much precision.
customer_reviews.author: Rick G

customer_reviews.title: Not Built to Last
customer_reviews.text: It is August of 2020. We purchased the Schwinn during May of 2018. Once before, the right armature broke and Schwinn replaced it for only a shipping charge. It cost us about $200 to get the part reinstalled. By August of 2020, both the left and right armatures are defective and we will not invest another $350 to reinstall two new parts. When new, the bike is great. After 2 years of every other day use of 30 minutes, it is engineered to break. Buyer beware. Schwinn is now owned by another company.
customer_reviews.author: Marty K

customer_reviews.title: Will take a beating
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews about bolts falling out, peddles coming off etc, i figured out the cheapest solution. Use Threadlocker on all threaded screws and peddles, its 3 bucks almost anywhere. I'm 285lbs, and can keep a constant 25mph for 20 min, even after a heart attack, and nothing has came loose. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built, but factory seat must be upgraded
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Airdyne AD2 about 2 months ago primarily for my wife and for me to use during winter months. Overall, it's a solidly built bike and gets the job sone but the seat is really uncomfortable (small and minimal padding) so plan on investing about $100 more for a good seat (Bikaroo oversized seat) and adaptor plate. Another side note: Mine arrived with some damage to the lower frame bracket that was damaged during shipping but I was able to bend/hammer it back in place--this was no fault to the manufacturer and I didn't want to go through the hassle of a return.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely outstanding workout and very high quality.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the AD7 after a lot of research and was not disappointed. My son is a high level athlete and recently he had an ACL tear and surgery. The physical therapist recommend a bike for recovery. I could not be more happy with the Air Dyne. It assembly easy, is very high quality and works great. Could not have made a better purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tony B.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service through Schwinn, and bike is not sturdy enough for the price point.
customer_reviews.text: The return date just passed on May 31st, the right bike pedal broke the 30th. I figured I would just go through Schwinn to do a warranty fix. One week and no response through email, and the phone lines just constantly cut you off before you get a rep on the phone. Do yourselves a favor, and don’t deal with a company that wants to milk the vivid hoax for all its worth. For less than 900 you can get a rogue fitness which is way sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: John Paul Piecyk

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a conditional review as we've only had it a few days, but based on the apparent quality of the parts and solidity of the unit once together, it should be fine. As others have said, most anyone should be able to put it together with an occasional assist from someone else. The instructions are very clear and detailed (with pictures) which is a refreshing change from what is usual these days Even the tools are supplied. Happy so far..
customer_reviews.author: Rich A.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bike, Very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This bike is awesome. I actually put it together myself (and I am not mechnically inclined). All the parts are labeled, and the bolts/screws are packaged and labeled by size. All tools to assembly are also included. The ride is nice and smooth. The arms also include a little foot rest so you can just work your arms if you want. I was orginally looking at cheaper bikes, I am so glad I spent a little extra and got this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Marie Kropovitch

customer_reviews.title: Easy, You will Enjoy, Go ahead and make a PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.text: Just finished putting the AD6 together by myself. ... EASY ... Moved to the work out room ,,, EASY .... I received the package, the bike was delivered as promise ... Followed a YouTube installation ... Easy ... Just completed a 20 minute work out ... WOW ... Easy. What a FANTASTIC quality piece of equipment. You will not go wrong with this purchase. Oh by the way I'm 68 and if I can do it you can, because it is EASY> :)
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: left pedal broke after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: Left pedal keeps coming loose. The welded part has already broken. Total mileage is 366 so I would say this bike is junk. Not sure what happened to Schwinn but their products has gone downhill.
customer_reviews.author: Iris V.

customer_reviews.title: Either not put together properly or dmg during shipping.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to build but I noticed the railings weren't align, it's been a hell of a time trying to figure out how to fix it. Looks like it's unevening or one sides larger than the other. On top of that, UPS delivered it to the wrong address and I had to bring it inside. I'll see if it works since I'm almost done building but for 1k, you'd expect a non damaged product.
customer_reviews.author: Slashinhobo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent way to get an aerobic workout!
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty stationary bike which also gives you an upper body workout. Assembly was easy. The instructions are very clear and all the various parts are well labeled. The is one heavy bike, so unpack it in the garage and bring the parts in separately. It offers more choices of time, intensity, modes etc., than I will ever use!
customer_reviews.author: SJR

customer_reviews.title: One month into it I am up to an hour at up to 80% MHR happy happy
customer_reviews.text: I have severe back problems and even walking on the treadmill gives me problems. I cannot do enough to get my heart rate up. I was in physical therapy and did warm ups with airdyne without any pain so I took a chance and bought this. One month into it I am up to an hour at up to 80% MHR happy happy
customer_reviews.author: Lex

customer_reviews.title: I am a private trainer and highly recommend this model.
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived quickly. I was very impressed on how easy it was to put together. I have an older model and was thinking this was the same thing. To my surprise this model was updated and a lot smoother. I am a private trainer and I have customers that are a different Fitness levels this is the perfect machine for all of them. Some customers just sit on it casually and write it for light cardio While others go as hard as they can for hiit training. I can't recommend a better piece of equipment. I recommend all my customers to buy one and I also put them on it almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product - Clunking noise from the crank. Bearings are bad after only two months. Can't return....
customer_reviews.text: After only a couple months the bike is making a loud clunking noise within the pedals which seems to be a bad bearing in the crank. My return limit is reaching and can not send it back. Just sad. Paid a good amount of money for the bike. I guess Schwinn is not what it used to be. If I bought a used Airdyne bike from the 80's or 70's it would have lasted a life time. The products that are put out these days are total crap.
customer_reviews.author: Chris DeVito

customer_reviews.title: The Quality and Comfort I Expected
customer_reviews.text: I know there have been a number of reviews here that have complained about quality and decrying the distance to the handlebars and the seat. My experience has been very positive in all aspects - quality, comfort, and ease of assembly. This is our second Airdyne. The first lasted nearly a decade, but it had finally reached the end of the road and we went for another. We exercise daily and need dependable equipment. After several weeks with the new Airdyne I see no reason it won't last as long, or longer, than the one it replaces.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike for the money. At a little more than $300, it will be hard to find a bike that will sustain as much use & abuse as the Schwinn AD2. I've got one at my house and at the gym where I workout. The bike at the gym is 3 or 4 years old and it gets at least 3-4 hours per day of continuous use and it's still as good as the new one I just bought. Sure you can find some cheaper options at the big box sports stores, but for the money this bike is one of the best.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: NICE MACHINE:  1 PROBLEM
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for summer house. I have 30 year old airdyne at home and love it. I have ALS and trying to keep moving to fight off the Grim Reaper. This bike lets me work both arms and legs. 1 major problem: seems like fan blade installed backwards at factory as you don't get cooling effect of fan unless you pedal backwards!! I can't do that. I should say seller provided very fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: B.Rubble

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cardio machine. Very well built and sturdy and the monitor is all I need. Has intervals preprogrammed and custimizable workouts. It is not as loud as some of the other bikes I’ve used and this one unlike the rogue echo which is also amazing works for shorter people. My wife is 5’2 and struggled a little on the echo but because this has a double handle (a higher and lower) she was more comfortable on the Airdyne AD7. I love them both so it didn’t matter to me. If you’re looking for a good cardio machine that will add some strength you’re looking at the right bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this bike! I inherited an older model a few year back and literally rode the pedals right off the bike.... at the time I was in college and rather than repairing the bike, it went to the curb. Now between work and kids the gym isn't alaways an option. So I purchased this bike to replace the one I broke (it was 20+ years old) when I drove the pedal off the frame into the floor. With all that being said, It's safe to say I'm very happy with my purchase and will be using this bike for a longtime.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase. Quiet, sturdy, challenging.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best air bike on the market. I’ve owned 4 other Airdyne, all great bikes, but when I got on this one, I was blown away. This is the must have bike, totally worth the extra money. Great arm workout not found in other airbikes. The ONLY thing I would change is the seat adjustments, though they finally improved it, it still requires some screwing in rather than just pulling the tab. No comparison , crushes the Assault bike and previous Airdyne, especially the ad2 and ad 6 models.
customer_reviews.author: chris person

customer_reviews.title: Help! Awesome bike, wiggly arm....but not anymore!
customer_reviews.text: I love the bike, however, the left arm wiggles and it's driving me crazy. I reached out to Schwinn. Standby.. Update... I spoke to a service rep. and he helped me fix it in less than 2 min! Turns out the left arm bolt heads need to face toward the seat and the right away! I assembled incorrectly... I'm VERY happy with the bike! Great customer service!!! Bike is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: John Moy

customer_reviews.title: Tachometer Doesn't Work!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got around to assembling this - (Bought in January) - and the Tachometer, tracking doesn't work at all. Incredible amount of money for a bike that simply shows the timer only ... I miss the old Analog Schwinn Exercise Bikes ... they just WORKED.
customer_reviews.author: The Yeti

customer_reviews.title: Best low impact cardio machine!
customer_reviews.text: So far this bike seems very sturdy and high quality. Instructions say assembly requires 2 people but I was able to assemble by myself in about an hour. The arms are a little tricky but once you line them up and see how they fit, it isn't bad at all. Good piece of cardio equipment - you can get an easy, light workout, or go all out and have it destroy you! Very low impact. I got this to use while recovering from a foot injury but will continue to use it because it's really a great workout!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy! arrived BROKEN twice and they wouldn't replace
customer_reviews.text: This bike arrived broken once. Amazon processed a swap and the second one also arrived broken. They refuse to swap it out or return it for a working model. Emails and calls made to Schwinn went unanswered. Don't buy this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was expecting longevity, you’re supposed to get what you paid for!
customer_reviews.text: Had this bike running smoothly for nearly 4 years and the drive belt snapped. I purchased a replacement and installed, 2 or 3 months later the belt snapped again. Was expecting this to last decades, now I’m on the fence about ordering another belt that will drive or toss it out. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beast workout
customer_reviews.text: Schwinn AD7 Product is great. It does get a bit loud if you pedal fast. It creates like a tornado of wind which is cool. But mannnn is this workout a beast. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Great workout
customer_reviews.text: I had used one of these when I went to a gym and loved it because of the great cardio workout I got on it. When the covid lockdown happened I was left without a way to workout so I bought this and loved it immediately. You’re able to get a upper body and/or lower body workout simultaneously. I’d highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Bike seat is VERY UNCOMFORTABLE!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this bike was recommended for seniors. I can only ride it for 10 minutes because the seat is SUPER HARD! How could such a good name bike be sold this way. I have investigated and bought a BIKEROO seat but then it needs an adaptor? Gel seat cover? Don't know what to do...it all will be an addiitional $100.00! That is so unfair. I should have bought a different bike! Someone help me to solve this problem. First time I am disappointed in Amazon...The bike was not cheap! Who can I contact???
customer_reviews.author: Sue A.

customer_reviews.title: Seat hardware is awful
customer_reviews.text: The seat hardware (and so far the customer service) is junk. Not acceptable for a bike in this price range. The bike itself is actually really well made but shipping it with cruddy seat hardware is certainly not appreciated. Since nobody is contacting me back from customer service, and since I otherwise like the bike, we will be heading off with the seat stem to our local bike store to get something usable installed. Warning: after installing the seat, DONT ASSUME THE SEAT IS TIGHT ON THE HARDWARE-IT CAN FLIP YOU OFF BACKWARDS.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Davies

customer_reviews.title: All About That Bass
customer_reviews.text: This is a great exercise bike, just like I remember it from decades ago. It was easy to assemble, runs smoothly, no squeaking (yet), will work with a variety of heights. However, I cannot give it more than 3 stars because the seat on this thing is practically false advertising. I cannot imagine anyone not replacing or putting some kind of cushion on this seat. They might as well sell it without one. Nevertheless, it seems to be a really good exercise bike so far.
customer_reviews.author: andyoctober

customer_reviews.title: 30 DAY REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: Solid bike, very sturdy, very comfortable and smooth! hiit programs or custom programs. Many seat adjustments height, up and down, and forward and backwards. Wide seat nice. Nice big digital screen. Improvements needed, ad in the power adapter instead of making the consumer pay another 30 dollars. Batteries will run the digital screen, however they only last 1 month. Digital screen could use a back light. The beeping sound in hiit mode is hard to hear. This is a nice exercise bike, I would recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it, found handle bar extensions that work
customer_reviews.text: Went together with ease. Very easy to use. update: my wife needed handle bar extensions, since the manufacturer did not offer any, I found handle bar mounts the work great on Amazon: Kbrotech 3.8 out of 5 stars 140 Reviews Kbrotech Bike Handlebar Extender Double Handlebar Extension Carbon Fiber Mount Holder with Aluminum Alloy Bracket Space Saver $15.99 ea you will need two of them.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G.

customer_reviews.title: Will Kick Your Butt
customer_reviews.text: So far absolutely love this bike. It kicks my butt when I go hard on it. Putting it together was pretty easy but took a bit. Highly recommended if you are looking for a high quality exercise bike.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.3

customer_reviews.title: It's worth $1,000
customer_reviews.text: I have used Schwinn Airdynes for years but this beast is another breed. The smooth belt drive system and solid construction make this thing so effective and comfortable to use. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alan J Sweitzer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my husband. He uses it every day. He loves the versatility of the bike. He can do the arm exercise separately, the leg exercise separately or both together. Was just what he was looking for at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A. Hart

customer_reviews.title: It could be a great exercise bike, but
customer_reviews.text: The Bike works great and is perfect for working out except I have had to replace the right crank and foot pads for the 3rd time in a 5 year period. The foot pad and crank strip out over time from use. I try and make sure they are always tight but to no avail. It usually costs me $40 to order and ship new parts which puts the machine down for about 10 days. A bit of a hassle for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit very well
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable. The seat, pedal, hand bar relationship is odd. It feels like the hand bars are too far away and the seat is not over the pedals. Plus, the seat is uncomfortably wide and slippery. The seat base is plastic where it clamps to the adjustable post. You can't tighten it enough to keep the seat from tilting forward all the time. If you have long arms, and short legs, and don't weigh much, you may like this machine. I will be looking for a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: The perfect exercise bike
customer_reviews.text: This bike is a great option for a small room and people with differing fitness levels. It works you harder the harder you pedal. There is no electronic parts or friction parts to wear out. My guess is this will last 20-30 years with fairly regular use with hardly if any issues
customer_reviews.author: rdcall

customer_reviews.title: Belt Broke After 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these bikes around three months ago. They came quickly, were relatively easy to put together and seem to work fine. Last week, after normal use, a belt broke on one. Called Schwinn, no help at all in getting a replacement belt. Beware, there apparently isn't a warranty on any part of this machine. Awful customer service. Only one we could find online was $57. For a belt that's all of a couple feet long. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Adams

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy
customer_reviews.text: Quality machine so far, a tiny bit of play in the arm bars, not sure if this is normal or an assembly error? Love the foot straps, I hurt myself a few times on the airdyne evo comp because my feet would slip off! I wish this machine would have hand bars off to the side of the seat for pedal only riding. It should also come with the HR strap for how much it costs! A spot for a tablet would be nice too! My last airdyne's arm bar broke in half after 5+ years I hope this one last at least that long before falling apart. Overall airdyne is a wonderful tool for exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the this machine!! Its an intense work out and so convenient being that it does not take up alot of room. Resistance is great the faster you go the harder it is you basically control the intensity with your speed. !! Definitely recommend. 30 min feels like a 2 hour work out amazing!!!
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sturdy bike for heavier people
customer_reviews.text: This bike was everything I was looking for after total knee replacement. Strong,sturdy,and durable. I am 61 woman and I was able to assemble it without issue. Love the wheels for moving it also. Unfortunately COMPANIES NEVER consider short people [i am 5”2”) and the seat cannot go lower than I have it and the arm bars are too far away to be comfortable. I am going to have to sell it since it is really uncomfortable for me to use.
customer_reviews.author: SHELLE

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived broken and I have yet to receive a resolution from the seller. The LCD Display does not work and the seller will not solve my problem. Other than that the bike was easy to construct. Horrible horrible customer experience.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Takes up very little space
customer_reviews.text: The bike itself is fine. I won't be riding it hard like a younger person might. that's why I got the less expensive one. I would love to be able to replace the seat on this bike. I bought a padded cover, but it doesn't make that much of a difference. I know one of the more expensive bikes comes with a wider seat, but it looks like it attaches differently. This seat can't be replaced with a regular bike seat.
customer_reviews.author: Trician

customer_reviews.title: The bike it’s self seems to be fine, and performs exactly as I expected Assembly
customer_reviews.text: The bike it’s self seems to be fine, and performs exactly as I expected Assembly, however, is another factor. The frame where the stabilizers attach was bent, so I had to break out the vice grips to repair it. Also, make sure you get some masking tape and put over the holes between the fan and the drivetrain cover. Lost both a bolt and the Allen wrench into the whole and had to remove the cover in order to retrieve them. Pain in the rear.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Lawler

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Way better than the gym.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Quiet. Ultra smooth. Heavy Duty. Simple with no complex electronics to break. Super workout, or easy workout. Great to have upper body involved. Love it. Cons, no place to put a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: 30 Weight

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: This thing is no joke. I have a treadmill, and this airdyne is a completely different animal compared to what I’m used too. It really puts me to the test. I’m still building up to where I can put some real time on this air bike and burn some calories. There is absolutely no way a person could “outgrow” this airdyne. I really like it for that reason. It is a great piece of equipment to incorporate into an existing exercise routine.
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: Seat assembly is problematic
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews, I saw the comments about how great the bike is, and I saw how lousy the seat assembly is , but I ordered it anyway, thinking, "How bad can it be?" Well, the seat perch design is terrible. You would think they would redo it from the plastic part that gives way when you sit on the seat. Within minutes, I was sliding off the front of the seat. Very frustrating. The seat itself is very comfortable. And, so far after three days, the bike works well. It wasn't hard for me to put together myself. I ordered a new seat. We'll see if that solves the problem.
customer_reviews.author: L. McClanahan

customer_reviews.title: Watch Your Sellers
customer_reviews.text: I received the item by UPS and they left it on the front porch without ringing the door bell, I work from home, so I know. I knew why when I looked at the box, in real bad shape with a hole in one corner beaten up badly. I thought the machine would be damaged, to my surprise it was not. However, there were missing small parts that I had to replace and fortunately that the machine was new, Octane Fitness, honored the warranty and sent the parts I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Cross Training Bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike because it's the one I used in cardio rehab. I especially like the movable arm handles that you use while pedaling. I've only had it assembled for two days but we're already riding it. I do need help setting the features on the display; when I follow the manual instructions, I don't get the results I need. That does not prevent my riding it, however.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Foster Angelou

customer_reviews.title: No plug in adaptor
customer_reviews.text: Runs fine, but it is annoying to pay this much for an exercise bike and then have to pay another $24 plush shipping for the adaptor necessary to run the controls from an outlet. A machine this expensive should come with the optional adaptor.
customer_reviews.author: Sigrid Fry-revere

customer_reviews.title: Having a high quality bike with a "tacky" console without a light is disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: The Schwinn AD6 Airdyne Exercise Bike is a high quality exercise bike EXCEPT it diminishes that quality by NOT providing an LED light on the console. I cannot believe that Schwinn would miss such an important critical design. A lot of money not to be able to read the display. I've had to put labels on the console to help read the numbers. DISAPPOINTING! I have not experience the seat to be as bad as some reviews have indicated - however, it too could be more stable. Had to really crank down on tightening the seat bolt.
customer_reviews.author: JWM

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for home equipment
customer_reviews.text: This was our second fan style bike in our quest to get something in our apartment post COVID gym shutdowns. Things we've loved: -It's not too loud for our apartment -Easy to put together -Quality parts/build -Good workout -Customer Service (though wait times are currently really long) Things we've not been too please with: -bike seat adjusts only one way Highly recommend using lock tight or similar product on the bike to just keep everything in place.
customer_reviews.author: A.N.G.

customer_reviews.title: Best air bike
customer_reviews.text: I've used airdynes for years as cross training for running. The main difference I find among models is the resistance as follows: The easiest resistance is the AD6 (has a smaller fan) The AD4 and older models are same (medium resistance) The AD7 has the greatest resistance (so if you are used to the AD4 traditional fan models you will have to ride the AD7 at lower RPMs) I prefer the resistance on the AD4 and older models because that's what I've always used. Alot of good videos on great workouts on these airbikes. Great to use in high intensity training and intervals. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle B Combest

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Heavy-duty high quality bike
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Heavy-duty high quality bike. I really like the interval options.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Cracraft

customer_reviews.title: You found it
customer_reviews.text: Stop looking for any other stationary bikes. Just fork over the extra dollars for the AD7. It's the best and it's worth it. If you only have one piece of cardio equipment, this is the winner. You're welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Jacques

customer_reviews.title: I have issues with the seat.
customer_reviews.text: My one issue is the seat. It will not go back any farther and will not tighten down properly so it tilts and shifts any time you sit on it. The pedals feel like they are right under you and in my opinion they should be forward of the seat more and there should be an additional seat bracket either included or as an add on to accommodate different riders.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Field

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bike, Difficult to Move.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Easy to unpack and assemble. Seat is not comfortable, recommend immediate upgrade on arrival. Difficult to move around, wheel system needs redesign. I will use more often when I get a better seat.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Pandemic exercise!
customer_reviews.text: No gyms are open, but I’m always way too cheap to pay for a membership anyway. This is SUCH a nice bike and will definitely be great to have this winter so I don’t have to go anywhere to be active.
customer_reviews.author: Dazednconfused

customer_reviews.title: The item came with a bent frame, it is ...
customer_reviews.text: The item came with a bent frame, it is unable to be assembled. This has been verified by Schwinn Technician. I Have been trying to get a replacement or a complete refund. Unfortunately, I haven't been able to find the return with-OUT having to pay the return shipping since the item received is broken and Unusable, no fault of my own. If necessary I can Post the photos!
customer_reviews.author: Mbubz

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble. I am a 62 year old women and I assembled it by myself including getting it out of the box. Very sturdy and seems to work well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Larner

customer_reviews.title: Great value for home workout
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had two of these over the last 5 years. I love this model for home use. It has a relatively small footprint and is easy to move around. Great workout on this machine. It is noisy when you are grinding out a metcon, but I think all bikes are at that point
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended by a co-worker who used it to get in ...
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended by a co-worker who used it to get in shape. Really an awesome bike if you have the room for it and can't always get out to exercise. Changed our lives in minutes a day.
customer_reviews.author: Way2GoSpaceDog

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Did not have a problem assembling this Schwann AD 6. However, when I started to cycle on it, I find the cage surrounding the fan was incorrectly assembled making it scrape the fan blades as it rotates. Impossible to use the Airdyne as it sits. QUALITY CONTROL. OBVIOUSLY NONE. Can’t get ahold of Schwann.
customer_reviews.author: Carleen A. Rainey

customer_reviews.title: The quality of this bike is not as good as my previous Schwinn - that lasted not quite ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few years ago and still use it. I am heavier and really ride it hard (about 7.5 miles in 30 minutes) 3 to 4 times every week. The quality of this bike is not as good as my previous Schwinn - that lasted not quite 9 years. This new one developed a knock after about 5 months and no matter what I do, I cannot fix it. I tighten things regularly and the knock does not interfere with the function.
customer_reviews.author: Stacia Swisher

customer_reviews.title: Let peeves
customer_reviews.text: I know I have purchased a well built exercise bike. But the only completed I have is:1 The seat has no adjustment for forward and backward adjustment and:2 The seat seems loose by rocking it backward and forward. The design of the seat mount needs to be fixed!
customer_reviews.author: Geno

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy the quality build and design. Seat make me sore.
customer_reviews.text: Holding back one star due to how uncomfortable the seat is. Both me and my wife have a high level of discomfort after using the bike for 30 minute sessions. The seat can be distracting from the workout. Otherwise everything is great with this bike. Easy installation. You create your own resistance level due to the fan system. I'm off to search for a proper seat cover to minimize that discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn AD6 a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bike with the hope that it would be a newer & better version of the AD4 that we have had for over six years. Unfortunately, it is quite different & when we called the information help line to get assistance with some personal adjustments on the bike they weren't too helpful. The whole frame & seat were much higher then the AD4 & that wasn't apparent on your website with the description you provided. So needless to say, we are still hopeful that we will be able to modify this model & not have to return it!
customer_reviews.author: C M G

customer_reviews.title: Console does not work
customer_reviews.text: We ordered TWO of these bikes as Christmas presents - NEITHER console will turn on. Replaced batteries and double checked all connections.... weird. Other than that the bikes look great, and spin smooth, but it has to be more than a fluke if neither console works. Will update review when problem is resolved
customer_reviews.author: amy fox

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy product which was my main concern
customer_reviews.text: I was 315 lbs when I purchased this. I'm down to 290 lbs now. I've been doing interval training, rotating between this bike and the treadmill. Very sturdy product which was my main concern. Easy to assemble. Been using it for a few months now off and on. Works Great!!!
customer_reviews.author: CSA

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: I was leery about what the quality would be. I am a 66 year old woman and put this bike together in about an hour and a half. It works great. The only part I couldn't do by myself was carry it upstairs because it's heavy, but that's to be expected. Seems to be a high quality product, smaller, quieter, and doesn't blow air on you as the old one did so I'll be able to use it in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Electronic less than satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice exercise bike, I was able to assemble and operate with no problems. It allows me to exercise with my knee problems just like a bike. The electronic display is sub-par. The only useful feature is the clock. The default displays can not be changed (and reset to values useful). The display are all most impossible to read while riding, I was aware that heart rate required additional equipment, so that was at least made obvious. The seat is comfortable and adjustments are made easily. A very good piece of exercise equipment, but doesn't promote info well.
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cardio for all ages
customer_reviews.text: I have back issues that pretty much rule ellipticals and treadmills out if I want to do HIIT cardio. This enables me to go full throttle like I used to when I could sprint and jog with no lower back pain consequences. HIIT obviously isn't the only option on this thing but if you really want to ramp things up even if you DON'T have lower back issues, this thing will get you there.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

product_meta.title: Schwinn Airdyne Bike Series
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes One Schwinn Airdyne AD6 Bike
Exercise bike dimensions: 49.7” L x 25.7” W x 50.9” H | Product weight: 112 pounds | Weight capacity: 300 pounds | Power – 2 AA batteries
Self-balancing foot pedals with foot straps
RevMeter RPM gage for interval training
Progressive wind resistance for infinite levels of challenge. Efficient single stage belt drive that keeps it running quietly

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
